Hi all,

Sorry I was a little slow in checking this out. The Minoto Taikan had a
small sized oshigata and that compared very well. Even better was Nihonto
Zuikan -- yes, if you do not have this set of books, you will never know
what you have. There were two, first gen. oshigata here and they both
matched very well, particularly the katana oshigata. So, my call -- genuine
signature of 1st. gen. Shinano no Kami Daido, circa Kanei.

Gordon
  -----Original Message-----
  From: Ron Polansky [mailto:yamabrp@...]
  Sent: Monday, May 05, 2003 11:34 PM
  To: nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com
  Subject: [nihontostudy] Mino Daido


  All:

  I was wondering if someone had a Mino Taikon that had a matching mei:
  Shinano (no) Kami Fujiwara Daido
  http://www.nihontophile.com/Daido1.jpg (nakago rubbing)
  http://www.nihontophile.com/Daido2.jpg (picture of blade)
  (hada is tighter than most Mino I have seen)

  I was wondering which generation?
  (judging by the sori, etc., I was guessing 1st generation...blade
  looks early Shinto)

  Thanks for the help!
  Ron
